entry.title: Presentations and make up sessions
entry.content: You should have all received two different emails asking you to fill out two Doodle polls. One is for scheduling in-class presentations. The other one is for scheduling make up sessions. Please contact me as soon as possible if you did not receive either of those two emails.

entry.title: Addendum: Readings for 1/22
entry.content: I strongly encourage you to look at the sequel to 'Desire as Belief'. I will go over both formulations of the argument, but the one in the later paper is probably easier to follow.

entry.title: Readings for 1/22
entry.content:
Next week we will start by discussing Smith's 'Humean Rationality' (which was assigned for last week -- please remember to bring your copy of the handout!). We will then move on to talk about Lewis' 'Desire as Belief'. (You can also take a look at the sequel if you're so inclined.)

Remember: you can use the USC library bookmarklet to access the readings if you are off- campus.

entry.title: Readings for our first meeting
entry.content:
A draft of the course syllabus is now online. For the first day of class, you should read:

  • Michael Smith's handbook article on Humean Rationality.
  • Lloyd Humberstone's 'Direction of fit'.

If you haven't yet, I recommend you also take a look at Section iii of Part III of Book II of Hume's Treatise.

I will upload a pdf version of chapter 4 of Smith's The Moral Problem in the next few days. This is not required reading, but is worth taking a look.
